definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: After spending two years together, they are now inseparable.
sentences.chinese: 兩年的相處讓他們如今形影不離。

sentences.english: The two friends cling together wherever they go.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個朋友不論走到哪裏都形影不離。

sentences.english: We are all with together, the whole day mean like potatos and carrot.
sentences.chinese: 我們倆形影不離，整天就像土豆和胡蘿蔔一樣。

sentences.english: Wei Wei did that by herself when she was young. Language is always useful.
sentences.chinese: 難免，韋唯每次演出他總是形影不離的處理很多工作。

sentences.english: So lice have been with us since the world's first clothes were made.
sentences.chinese: 在世界第一件衣服出現後蝨子也就和我們形影不離了。

sentences.english: China and the UK have also been working closely on a global scale.
sentences.chinese: 中英在國際事務中近年也是“形影不離”。

sentences.english: Look at this pair, always together.
My friend and I are beginning to be known as a twosome.
sentences.chinese: 我和朋友形影不離，大家都知道。

sentences.english: And the President got to keep his precious BlackBerry.
sentences.chinese: 總統更是和他心愛的黑莓手機形影不離。

sentences.english: "White Tiger" and I got to know each, they will become inseparable friends.
sentences.chinese: “白虎”和我混熟之後，便成了形影不離的好朋友。

sentences.english: I am always here to plan with you.
sentences.chinese: 我總是形影不離，與你計議前程。

sentences.english: Later, they decided to be sworn brothers and became more intimate than before .
sentences.chinese: 後來，兩人結拜爲兄弟，更是時時刻刻，形影不離。

sentences.english: Miyuki and the dog gradually learn to accept each other, and soon become inseparable.
sentences.chinese: 美雪與小狗逐漸學會接受對方，並很快變得形影不離。

sentences.english: Doris and Flora are inseparable. They're like two peas in a pod.
sentences.chinese: 多麗絲和弗洛拉兩個形影不離，如膠似漆。

sentences.english: The 46-day-old calf now follows her wherever she goes.
sentences.chinese: 現在，46天大的牛犢和白形影不離。

definition: stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
lit. green plums and hobby-horse (idiom)/fig. innocent children's games/childhood sweethearts/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
